addr: Wilkins Building. Gower Street. London WC1E 6BT GB
title: UCL CLP: Commercial Applications of the Express Trust: Applying and Distorting Basic Concepts
desc: CURRENT LEGAL PROBLEMS? LECTURE SERIES 2015-16         Commercial Applications of the Express Trust:  Applying and Distorting Basic Concepts by Professor Michael Bryan, Melbourne School of Law Chaired by Lord Justice Beatson, Courts and Tribunals Judiciary ? on Thursday 5th May 2016, from 6-7pm Venue:   UCL Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre Accredited with  1 CPD hour  by the  Solicitors Regulation Authority and the Bar Standards Board ? About this lecture:         Express trusts are employed in various commercial contexts, including the structuring of collective investment and collective security schemes. These trusts also operate within a contractual framework, and many also operate within a statutory framework. About the speaker:? Michael Bryan is an Emeritus Professor of Law at the University of Melbourne, having previously lectured at Queen Mary College, University of London. He has written extensively on equity and trusts law, and is currently an editor of Ford and Lee's 'Principles of the Law of Trusts', a leading Australian practitioner text.
